JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: The applicants , PERSON and QUANTITY others are NORP nationals living in ORG , GPE region . Their names and dates of birth are listed in the appendix .
The applicants are co - owners of a company “ LOC saloon LOC located in PERSON ( “ the company ” ) .
On DATE , the company sued ORG of Novokuznetsk in ORG , claiming property rights on a building located in PERSON and used by the company for its professional activities .

On DATE , the court dismissed the company 's claims finding that the building at issue had not been included in the real estate subject to privatisation and that the company 's action was time barred .
The company lodged an appeal with ORG , contesting the lower court 's finding that the action was time - barred . On DATE , ORG upheld the first instance judgment .
The Appellate Instance of ORG continued to consider commercial cases on appeal until DATE when the Seventh ORG of Appeal started its activities in GPE .

The company applied to ORG for ORG against the lower court 's decisions on the ground that they had distorted the facts and violated material law . On DATE the court dismissed the company 's complaint and upheld the previous judgments .
On an unspecified date , the company lodged an application for supervisory review with ORG . On DATE , a single judge declared the application admissible .

On DATE ORG , sitting in a committee of CARDINAL judges , dismissed the company 's application for supervisory review of the lower courts ' judgments . The court concluded that the application , which relied upon “ violations of substantive and procedural law ” , was in effect aiming at the reconsideration of the lower courts ' conclusions . Therefore , the court did not find any ground for examination of the case by the Presidium of ORG in accordance with Article CARDINAL of LAW .

LAW ( No . CARDINAL ) in force since DATE provided for setting up of commercial courts of appeal . It provided , in particular , that the Seventh ORG of Appeal be set up by DATE for review of judicial decisions of commercial courts of the LOC , GPE , GPE , GPE regions and of GPE ( Article CARDINAL and new Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) introduced in LAW on commercial courts of GPE ( No . MONEY ) of CARDINAL DATE ) .

Under LAW , a commercial court of appeal is considered as set up once the minimum of CARDINAL judges are appointed on its bench ; its activities start on the date to be determined by the Plenum of ORG ; the appellate instances of regional commercial courts continue reviewing cases on appeal up until the start of activities of the relevant court of appeal .
On DATE the Plenum of ORG , after having examined the report of the President of the Seventh ORG , decided that the activity of the latter would start on DATE .

The Code of Commercial Procedure ( no . CARDINAL-FZ of CARDINAL DATE ) in force before DATE provided that final judgments and decisions of commercial courts were amenable to supervisory review initiated on an application by the President of ORG or his deputy or by ORG or his deputy ( Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) .
On DATE , LAW of LAW for the review of courts ' decisions by way of supervision ” ( “ Производство по пересмотру судебных актов в порядке надзора ” ) entered into force .

According to LAW , an application for supervisory review may be lodged with ORG by the parties to the case or certain other persons entitled by the Code if they consider that the contested judicial decision substantially violates their rights and legitimate interests in commercial or other economic activities due to a breach or improper application by a commercial court of material or procedural law . The application for supervisory review may be lodged within DATE after the contested judicial decision enters into force , if all other judicial remedies were exhausted .

According to the transitional provisions of the PERSON on the Introduction of LAW of DATE ( Федеральный закон « О введении в действие Арбитражного процессуального кодекса PERSON No . CARDINAL-ФЗ ) , the supervisory review proceedings against the court decisions delivered before DATE could be brought before ORG within DATE from DATE ( Article CARDINAL ) .

The admissibility of the application ( вопрос о принятии заявления или представления к производству ) is decided by a single judge within DATE after receipt of the application ( Article CARDINAL ) . Once declared admissible , the application is considered by a committee of judges , which decides , within DATE after receipt of the application or of the case - file , whether to send the case to the ORG of ORG for supervisory review ( Article CARDINAL ) . If the conditions provided for in Article CARDINAL are satisfied , the court makes a decision to send the case for supervisory review and transmits the case to the ORG within DATE after this decision ( Article CARDINAL ) . The ORG will consider the case within DATE after the decision to transmit the case to the ORG ( LAW ) .
Article CARDINAL , as originally adopted , provided as follows :
Article CARDINAL Grounds for revising or repealing by way of supervision of the judicial decisions entered into legal force

“ Judicial decisions of the commercial courts entered into legal force shall be revised or repealed if the Presidium of ORG of GPE reviewing the case by way of supervision finds that the contested judicial decision :
CARDINAL ) violates the uniformity of the interpretation of the legal norms by commercial courts ;
CARDINAL ) prevents the delivery of a lawful judicial decision in another case ;
CARDINAL ) violates the rights and legitimate interests of an undetermined number of people or other public interests . ”
On DATE , LAW DATE ( No . CARDINAL-ФЗ ) entered into force replacing the point CARDINAL above by the following :

“ CARDINAL ) violates the human and citizens ' rights and freedoms in accordance with the universally recognised principles and norms of international law and the international treaties of GPE ; ( ... ) . ”

Article CARDINAL of LAW provides for reopening of commercial proceedings on the basis of newly discovered circumstances . CARDINAL of the grounds allowing such reopening is a violation of the LAW found by ORG in the examination of a particular case by a commercial court on account of which the applicant complained to ORG ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) .
